What it’s used for: Core biosignal sensor; detects muscle activation (EMG) from limited hand/arm movement for control input
Provides stable electrical reference to reduce EMG noise and baseline drift
Skin–electrode interface for reliable and comfortable EMG signal pickup
Reads EMG and IMU data, processes signals, and sends control inputs to PC/game
Absolute orientation and gesture tracking for mapping arm/wrist motion to game controls
Secondary motion sensing for redundancy, calibration, or multi-segment motion tracking
Powers microcontroller and enables data transfer to computer
Rapid prototyping and testing of signal conditioning and connections
Electrical connections between sensors, microcontroller, and power rails
Portable power source for untethered testing and use
Filtering, smoothing, and stabilizing noisy EMG signals
Protects electronics and improves wearability and durability
Serial communication, debugging, and firmware flashing
Allows compatibility with modern USB-C laptops and devices
